attributes.action: A Royal Commission to review the awarding of Government contracts
attributes.additional_details:
A Royal Commission should be established to review the awarding of government [even if at 'arms length'] contracts to firms with board members who are either serving or former ministers or MPs, their spouses or family members, with a view to outlawing the practice as it brings the business of government and oversight into disrepute. 

http://voxpoliticalonline.com/2015/02/24/rifkind-firm-awarded-nhs-contract-despite-charging-7-million-more-than-nhs-prides-purge/
attributes.background: With recent contracts being awarded  to companies with board members or consultants  who are ex ministers or members of previous governments, or a married to setving government members. It must be esatblushed that no undue influence has been brought to bear
